channel.title: posts on Kai Kunze
channel.description: Recent content in posts on Kai Kunze

item.title: JST Presto Project on Open Eyewear
item.author: kai.kunze@pm.me (Kai Kunze)
item.description: I’m excited and happy to be one of few non-Japanese researchers to receive a JST Presto (Sakigake) project grant, on the Topic Open Collective Eyewear.

item.title: ISWC and UbiComp in Heidelberg
item.author: kai.kunze@pm.me (Kai Kunze)
item.description: It’s a strange feeling to have UbiComp and ISWC so close to my home. Amazing organization and impressive research and meeting old friends.

item.title: Kai at CHI 2016
item.author: kai.kunze@pm.me (Kai Kunze)
item.description: back @ this year’s CHI 2016. We just have 3 Late Breaking Work submissions accepted and it seems they are currently for free download at the ACM website

item.title: Lessons from the Dagstuhl Seminar on Eyewear Computing
item.author: kai.kunze@pm.me (Kai Kunze)
item.description: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->

item.title: Looking back on UbiComp/ISWC in Osaka
item.author: kai.kunze@pm.me (Kai Kunze)
item.description: Overall very pleasant and inspiring event, nice to see some old friends and meet new ones.

item.title: After my first SIGGRAPH
item.author: kai.kunze@pm.me (Kai Kunze)
item.description: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->

item.title: Affective Wear- Recognizing facial expressions
item.author: kai.kunze@pm.me (Kai Kunze)
item.description: Katsutoshi Masai, one of my Master students had the idea to track facial expressions using low cost sensors in glasses. Quite nice work ;)

item.title: Super Human Sports: Augmenting Blind Soccer
item.author: kai.kunze@pm.me (Kai Kunze)
item.description: I’m getting more and more fascinated by augmenting Blind Soccer. After 3 blind soccer trainings, we had now a couple of meetings to discuss how to extend and enhance the play experience.

item.title: 31C3 Talk Slides: Eye Wear Computing
item.author: kai.kunze@pm.me (Kai Kunze)
item.description: Here are the video and slides from my talk. Hope you like it. Please if you have some critique write me a mail.

item.title: 31C3 Aftermath
item.author: kai.kunze@pm.me (Kai Kunze)
item.description: Finally, I have a little time to write about the congress. As the last couple of years, I attended the 31st Chaos Communication Congress between Christmas and New Year.

item.title: Eye-Wear Computing
item.author: kai.kunze@pm.me (Kai Kunze)
item.description: Smart glasses and, in general, eyewear are a fairly novel device class with a lot of possibilities for unobtrusive activity tracking. That’s why I’m very excited to be working in the Team of Masahiko Inami Sensei at Keio Media Design to do research on J!NS MEME.

item.title: Google Glass for Older Adults
item.author: kai.kunze@pm.me (Kai Kunze)
item.description: As the first article about my grandparents using Google Glass received a lot of interest, I decided to delve a little bit more into the topic.

item.title: Looking forward to ISWC/Ubicomp 2014
item.author: kai.kunze@pm.me (Kai Kunze)
item.description: With roughly around 1 month to go, we are busy with demo preparations etc.

item.title: Augmented Human 2014
item.author: kai.kunze@pm.me (Kai Kunze)
item.description: Innovative research, that makes you first laugh and then think. The conference develops into one of my favorite venues.

item.title: Beyond FuturICT
item.author: kai.kunze@pm.me (Kai Kunze)
item.description: Attending the International Symposium on Service Systems Science in Tokyo, I got a glimpse on how the progress and the next steps of FuturICT …

item.title: Glass Talk at Hacker News Kansai
item.author: kai.kunze@pm.me (Kai Kunze)
item.description: Introducing Google Glass to Hacker News Kansai Community was a lot of fun.

item.title: Looking back at 30C3
item.author: kai.kunze@pm.me (Kai Kunze)
item.description: Impressions and Talk Recommendations. Finally, a couple of days with normal people …

item.title: 30C3 Toward a Cognitive Quantified Self
item.author: kai.kunze@pm.me (Kai Kunze)
item.description: Discussing activity recognition for the Mind and its potential applications.

item.title: Hacking Glass
item.author: kai.kunze@pm.me (Kai Kunze)
item.description: So I got my hands on another Glass device and can now play with it a bit longer.

item.title: Bits and Bytes instead of a Bookshelf
item.author: kai.kunze@pm.me (Kai Kunze)
item.description: An interview made me wonder about how reading habits are changing and how we will narrate stories in the future.

item.title: Amazing Okinawa - Attending the ASVAI Workshop
item.author: kai.kunze@pm.me (Kai Kunze)
item.description: Cool research discussions at a nice location. The workshop was perfect fit to my research interests.
